p: Studies in non-human primates have shown the prophylactic and therapeutic value of the drug in the MERS-CoV infection [ 19]. Another recent in-vitro study reported a half-maximal effective concentration (EC 50) that suggested the drug is likely to have a plausible working concentration in non-human primates. The investigators concluded that among several drugs tested, only remdesivir (and chloroquine) could inhibit the virus infection in human cells sensitive to SARS-CoV-2 [ 20].
